metadata.Title: CVE-2017-16672 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description: An issue was discovered in Asterisk Open Source 13 before 13.18.1, 14before 14.7.1, and 15 before 15.1.1 and Certified Asterisk 13.13 before13.13-cert7. A memory leak occurs when an Asterisk pjsip session object iscreated and that call gets rejected before the session itself is fullyestablished. When this happens the session object never gets destroyed.Eventually Asterisk can run out of memory and crash.

criterions.comment: asterisk: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
